title: sifat08
author: sifat08
content: I am a bounty hunter in this forum. How can I increase my rank by earning my merit points. and how much merit can make me higher rank like Sr, Hero, Legendary?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Check this thread[1], you can see the required merit each rank.Now, regarding the "earning merit points", well, you can't get any merit by just posting application post or whatever you call that in bounty threads based on your post history. I wonder why someone give you merit in the very first place. Start making quality posts or threads already.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.0

comments.author: coinerer
comments.body: Quote from: sifat08 on July 09, 2022, 05:10:57 AMI am a bounty hunter in this forum. How can I increase my rank by earning my merit points. and how much merit can make me higher rank like Sr, Hero, Legendary? Merit is a kind of reward. Which everyone gets based on their post quality. And if anyone likes your post.  And if he has Smerit then he can give you merit. It can be of different types.  Because not everyone's choice is the same, everyone's mentality is different. Like someone like meme and you post a good meme then he can give you a merit on your meme post. Or if someone like informative post and you made it then he/she can give you a merit. Merit is actually distributed in this way. Not everyone will give merit in all the posts. If I like a post, someone else may not like it. In that case, even if I give merit in that post, no one else will give it there. This is how the merit cycle works.Read the thread of Theymos. There are details available about how many merits can increase your rank and make you Hero/LegendaryQuote from: theymos on January 24, 2018, 11:00:11 PMIn addition to activity, everyone now has a merit score, and you need both a certain activity level and a certain merit score in order to reach higher member ranks. The required scores are:RankRequired activityRequired meritBrand new00Newbie10Jr Member301Member6010Full Member120100Sr. Member240250Hero Member480500LegendaryRandom in the range 775-10301000You get merit points when someone sends you some for one of your posts. Additionally, when someone sends you merit points, half of those points can be sent by you to other people.Note - You post only POA for different Bounty Campaign. These will never help you get any merit.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: OP, do bounty hunters actually earn any more for having a higher rank?  I know that's true for bitcoin-paying signature campaigns, but as far as I understand it a big part of bounties is spamming social media and not necessarily forum posting (although I know it's a big enough part that it contributes to forum shittiness significantly).I checked your post history and the only other post I could see besides the one you made here is when you voted in the community awards thread.  Plus your post count is very low in general for someone who registered in 2020.  I have no idea why you're just now asking about how to earn merits, but a general rule is that the more posts you make the better your odds are at earning merits.  If you remain at your current rate of posting, you'll be dead of old age before you'd even reached Full Member rank.That's assuming this is your only account, which I seriously doubt.
